Issue.creator: pandrejko
Issue.summary: Thorough review and edit of BYFN
Issue.description: BYFN - I am a little confused about the meaning of an "end-to-end" application? in ==> _"This will launch all of the containers, and then drive a complete_ _*end-to-end** application* scenario."_ Is it has the same meaning of "e2e" in the file name of docker-compose-e2e. yaml? If so, it shouldn't be an e2e application since it started a *cli* container: Answer from Chris: end-to-end (hence the e2e) is a hold-over term. basically, we had the e2e scenario in the fabric repo as a test that covered the entire lifecycle of deploying a network, deploying a trivial application (chaincode) and driving a few transactions before tearing it down. We still use this today. We turned it into a tutorial and it has grown arms and legs. >
